title: #rrggbbaa and #rgba color notation support
body: Couldn't find this anywhere here, so I'll post this feature request.

comments.body: Yeah come on Microsoft guys lets see this supported!
I will love to see rgba support in edge
It is so much easier when you have a hex value and want to introduce opacity, compared to converting to rgba() notation.

This feature is now supported in the other three major browser engines. Web developers should note that there is a PostCSS plugin that enables using these color values today safely, which means that they don’t have to wait for Edge’s implementation.
Technically the long form of #1234 would be #11223344
i also cant wait to use this since rgba() has landed!
